Fitness refers to the condition of being physically fit and healthy. It involves the ability to perform aspects of sports, occupations, and daily activities without undue fatigue. Fitness is achieved through proper nutrition, physical exercise, and sufficient rest.

Exercise is any bodily activity that enhances or maintains physical fitness and overall health. It is performed for various reasons, including strengthening muscles and the cardiovascular system, honing athletic skills, weight loss or maintenance, and enjoyment.

patterns: what are some upper body exercises
responses: Upper body strength training exercises include bench press, push-ups, dumbbell flyes for the chest; pull-ups, deadlifts, bent over rows for the back; shoulder press, lateral raises, front raises for the shoulders; and bicep curls, tricep dips, hammer curls for the arms.

patterns: what are some lower body exercises
responses: Lower body strength training exercises include squats, lunges, leg press for the legs; hip thrusts, glute bridges, Bulgarian split squats for the glutes; and calf raises, seated calf raises for the calves.
Core strength training exercises include planks, crunches, leg raises for the abs; and Russian twists, side planks, bicycle crunches for the obliques.
